snippet.title: Aussie nurse jailed in Cambodia
snippet.content: An Australian nurse has been jailed in Cambodia for providing commercial surrogacy services. Tammy Davis-Charles was today convicted in a Cambodian court after being found guilty of acting as an intermediary between a pregnant woman and an adoptive parent. She was sentenced to one and a half years in prison and a $1,200 fine. She has already spent nine months in jail. Cambodia banned commercial surrogacy last year after becoming a popular destination for would-be parents seeking women to give birth to their children.
